About Me

Favourite Languages

I prefer low level languages because I like to code in a way that is close to how the computer works.

C

This might be my favourite language, since it is the one I used the most for my projects and it allowed me to learn so much about compilation and memory management.

C++

Thanks to this language, I discovered many design patterns and learned much more about Object Oriented Programming.

Python3

I discovered almost all the algorithms I know using Python3.

Projects

Here are some of the projects I have been involved in.

  • 2018

    Unity First-person shooter in C#

    My first year at Epita, I worked on a unity game called "Salty Team". It is a Battle Royale in a maze. I was responsible for the gameplay and the network.

  • 2018

    Optical Character Recognition in C

    I implemented the image processing part of the program. So I had to split the text, resize each letter and send these letters to our neural network.

  • 2019

    Posix Shell in C

    My job for this project was to implement the parser to build the Abstract Syntax Tree, to traverse it in order to execute the commands and to deal with file descriptor redirections. I also created a second parser for the arithmetic expressions.

  • 2020

    Tiger Compiler in C++

    We implemented the front-end of a Tiger compiler. I mainly worked on the Abstract Syntax Tree, the binding phase and the translation to a High Intermediate Representation.

  • Currently Working On

    Chess game with an integrated AI in C++
